page.title: 06Primary School, Crowedge
page.content: The school consists of the two original classrooms, plus extensions added about 1963 which comprise 2 more classrooms,library,staffroom and toilets in just over an acre of grounds. The school was originally heated by coal fire places, then coal fired boiler and in recent years by electric storage heaters.The cellar boiler room was filled in in 1963 and {"amongst the rubble we placed samples {of childrens work together with coins {and present day newspapers". The caretaker's house, over 400 years old, was the Toll Bar on the pack horse road from Sheffield to Huddersfield. The present staff consists of 3 teachers, a non-teaching assistant and 3 kitchen staff. The school has had 13 head teachers. There are 14 people on the governing body of the school.
